129.speaker: PANDA
129.character: どうしたの　ペンギンさん　食あたり？
129.definition: What's wrong, Mr. Penguin? Did you get food poisoning?

131.speaker: LLAMA
131.character: ペン子さんのことですよね
131.definition: It's about Miss Penko, isn't it? N-No, it's not! I'm going to a driver's training school. He's trying to get his driver's license.

133.speaker: POLAR BEAR
133.character: ペン子さんをドライブに誘いたいみたい
133.definition: He wants to ask Miss Penko out for a drive.

134.speaker: PENGUIN
134.definition: H-How do you know that?! You wrote about it on your blog.

135.speaker: PENGUIN
135.character: あ～　ペン子さん　ペン子さん あなたと行きたい海辺のドライブ
135.definition: Oh, Miss Penko, Miss Penko, I want to take you on a drive by the ocean.

136.speaker: PENGUIN
136.character: 僕は通うよ　教習所
136.definition: Thus I am going to driving school.

137.speaker: PENGUIN
137.character: 人の日記勝手に読まないでよ！(#`O′)
137.definition: Don't read people's diaries without permission!

138.speaker: POLAR BEAR
138.character: いや　ブログってそういうものだし
138.definition: Well, blogs are meant for others to read.

139.speaker: LLAMA
139.character: 読まれたくないなら 非公開にした方がいいですよ
139.definition: If you don't want others to read it, you should make your blog private.

140.speaker: SASAKO
140.character: 教習所　大変なんですか？

142.speaker: PANDA
142.character: 車の運転って　そんなに難しいの？
142.definition: Is driving a car that hard?

143.speaker: PENGUIN
143.character: まあね 教えてくれる教官は厳しいし
143.definition: Yeah. The instructor is really mean

144.speaker: PENGUIN
144.character: 今日も縦列駐車ができなくってさ
144.definition: and I wasn't able to parallel park today.

145.speaker: POLAR BEAR
145.character: 最初は難しいよね　縦列駐車
145.definition: Parallel parking is always hard at first.

148.speaker: PANDA
148.definition: Ten cars in a row {\i1}(jyuretsu chusha){\i0}?

149.speaker: PANDA
149.definition: Ten shots in a row {\i1}(jyuretsu chusha){\i0}?

150.speaker: PANDA
150.definition: Ten headbands in a row {\i1}(jyuretsu kachusha){\i0}?

151.speaker: PANDA
151.definition: Ten kisses in a row {\i1}(jyuretsu chuu){\i0}?

152.speaker: PENGUIN
152.character: じゃあ　明日１１時に集合ね

153.speaker: PENGUIN
153.character: もう　聞いてなかったの？
153.definition: Jeez, weren't you listening at all?

156.speaker: LLAMA
156.character: シロクマさんに　ペンギンさんが運転の コツを教えてもらうんですよ
156.definition: Mr. Polar Bear is going to show Mr. Penguin the techniques of driving.

157.speaker: PENGUIN
157.character: パンダくん　どうせ暇でしょ？
157.definition: You don't have anything better to do anyways, do you, Panda?

158.speaker: PANDA
158.character: ゴロゴロするのに忙しいよ(*￣∇￣)ノ

159.speaker: PENGUIN
159.character: それって暇じゃないの？ まあいいや
159.definition: That would mean you have time. Oh, whatever.

160.speaker: PENGUIN
160.character: じゃあ　やめとく？　ドライブ
160.definition: Then do you not want to come driving? Oh, we're going on a drive? Of course I'll come!

161.speaker: PENGUIN
161.character: もう　じゃあ明日　カフェの前ね
161.definition: Jeez. Then we'll meet tomorrow right outside the café. Okay!

162.speaker: PENGUIN
162.character: パンダくん　まだかな？
162.definition: I wonder what's taking Panda so long.

166.speaker: PENGUIN
166.character: 遅いよ　パンダくん
166.definition: You're late, Panda. What's with the bamboo?!

167.speaker: PANDA
167.character: ドライブに　おやつは必要だよ
167.definition: You always need snacks when you go for a drive.

168.speaker: PANDA
168.character: みんなの分も持ってきたからね

169.speaker: PENGUIN
169.character: いや　いらないから

170.character: それ　パンダくんだけのおやつだし
170.definition: Not to mention that snack is only for you, Panda.

174.speaker: PENGUIN
174.character: いいから出発しようよ
174.definition: Come on, let's get going already.

175.speaker: PANDA
175.definition: Where's Mr. Llama? He had to work at the zoo today.

176.speaker: PENGUIN
176.character: じゃあ　シロクマくん　頼むね
176.definition: All right, let's get going then, Polar Bear.

177.speaker: PANDA
177.character: 後部座席って微妙だよね
177.definition: The backseats in cars are always questionable.

178.speaker: PANDA
178.character: 寝っ転がるには狭いしさ
178.definition: They're never big enough to sleep comfortably on.

179.speaker: PENGUIN
179.character: パンダくん　ちゃんと座って
179.definition: Sit up straight back there, Panda.

180.speaker: POLAR BEAR
180.definition: Okay, here we go. Amazing. You handled starting the car like a pro.

182.speaker: PENGUIN
182.character: ねぇ　コツは？　コツ

183.speaker: POLAR BEAR
183.character: そうだね　グッときたらピッとして ゴー！
183.definition: Well, let's see... Once you feel like this, you do this, and go!

185.speaker: PENGUIN
185.character: 抽象的だな　よくわかんないよ(o´∀｀o)
185.definition: That's a little too abstract. I don't understand any of it.

187.speaker: PANDA
187.character: つるしたタイヤに ジャレるみたいな感じだよ　たぶん
187.definition: It's probably something like when you're swinging from a tire swing.

188.speaker: PENGUIN
188.character: ますます　わかんないから
188.definition: You're making it even more confusing!

191.character: 笹が　いっぱい生えてそうな
191.definition: Especially one where there's plenty of bamboo grass. Somewhere around here is just fine. The whole point of this trip is so I can learn Polar Bear's driving techniques.

192.speaker: PENGUIN
192.character: シロクマくん　免許はいつ取ったの？
192.definition: When did you get your license, Polar Bear?

194.speaker: PENGUIN
194.character: いや　そうじゃなくてさ
194.definition: That's not exactly what I meant...

198.speaker: MAN
198.character: こんにちは　パンダくん

199.speaker: MAN
199.definition: Are you going on a trip?

202.speaker: PANDA
202.character: あ～あ なんか　お腹減っちゃったね

203.speaker: PENGUIN
203.character: 今　笹食べてたじゃない
203.definition: You were just eating bamboo grass! Let's go there!

204.speaker: WORKER
204.character: いらっしゃいませ ご注文は　お決まりですか？
204.definition: Welcome, are you ready to order?

205.speaker: PANDA
205.definition: Could I get bamboo or bamboo grass, please?

206.speaker: WORKER
206.character: 申し訳ありません 当店のメニューにはございません
206.definition: I'm terribly sorry, that is not on our menu.

207.speaker: POLAR BEAR
207.definition: We'll come back. Welcome, are you ready to order?

208.speaker: PENGUIN
208.character: フィッシュバーガー　フィッシュ　生で
208.definition: Can I get a fish burger? But I want the fish raw!

209.speaker: WORKER
209.character: 申し訳ありません 当店のメニューにはございません
209.definition: I'm terribly sorry, that is not on our menu.

211.speaker: WORKER
211.character: いらっしゃいませ ご注文は　お決まりですか？
211.definition: Welcome, are you ready to order?

212.speaker: POLAR BEAR
212.character: いいボケが思いつかないので
212.definition: I couldn't think of a good joke,

216.speaker: PENGUIN
216.character: だから フィッシュバーガーセットでいいじゃない
216.definition: That's why I'm telling you to get the fish burger meal!

217.speaker: PANDA
217.character: レタスバーガーセットがいいよ
217.definition: The lettuce burger meal is better.

218.character: 笹じゃないけど葉っぱだし
218.definition: It's not bamboo grass, but it is a leaf.

219.speaker: POLAR BEAR
219.character: てりやきバーガーセットがいいよ
219.definition: The teriyaki burger meal is better.

223.speaker: WORKER
223.character: あの　グルグル回らず そこで相談なさって かまいませんから！
223.definition: Um, you don't need to drive in circles! You can stay there until you decide!

224.speaker: WORKER
224.character: ご注文を　うけたまわりました

225.character: 受け渡し窓口まで お進みになって　お待ちください
225.definition: Please go to the next window to pick it up.

228.speaker: WORKER
228.character: ドライブスルーで遊ばないでくださいw(ﾟДﾟ)w
228.definition: Please don't play in the drive-thru!

229.speaker: PANDA
229.character: どう？　ペンギンさん　コツは　つかめた？
229.definition: What do you think, Mr. Penguin? Did you think you get the technique down?

231.speaker: POLAR BEAR
231.character: ドライブスルーで遊ぶコツ？
231.definition: The technique for playing in a drive-thru?

232.speaker: PENGUIN
232.character: 僕は　運転のコツを つかみたいんだけどな～
232.definition: I would like to learn the techniques of driving.

233.speaker: PANDA
233.character: ねえ　シロクマくん あれは　やらないの？
233.definition: Hey, Polar Bear, aren't you going to do that thing?

235.speaker: PANDA
235.character: ほら　わらしべ長者
235.definition: You know, Lord Straw Stalk {\i1}(Warashibe Chouja){\i0}.

238.speaker: PENGUIN
238.definition: Those are two completely different things.

239.speaker: POLAR BEAR
239.character: ペンギンさん　よくわかったね
239.definition: Good job on figuring that out, Mr. Penguin. Come on, Polar Bear, you should try it!

240.speaker: PENGUIN
240.character: ちゃんと運転のコツ教えてよ
240.definition: Show me a driving technique! Okay.

241.speaker: POLAR BEAR
241.character: よし　ここにしよう

242.speaker: POLAR BEAR
242.character: じゃあ　よく見ててね

243.speaker: POLAR BEAR
243.character: 周りをよく見て　バックする
243.definition: Look carefully at your surroundings, and then back up.

244.speaker: PENGUIN
244.character: よく見て　バックね
244.definition: So look carefully and then back up.

247.speaker: POLAR BEAR
247.character: こうやって　上からだと見やすい
247.definition: ...it's really easy to see when you stick your head out up here.

248.speaker: PENGUIN
248.character: 真似できないから！　もう…╮(￣▽￣")╭
248.definition: I can't do that, though! Jeez.

250.speaker: PENGUIN
250.definition: Is everything okay? Did you hit something?

252.speaker: SASAKO
252.character: あっ　シロクマさん

253.speaker: SASAKO
253.character: 今日は皆さんでドライブですか？ どちらまで？
253.definition: Are you all going for a drive today? Where are you all headed?

255.speaker: POLAR BEAR
255.definition: Where are you headed, Miss Sasako?

257.speaker: SASAKO
257.definition: Oh, I know. Here, I'll share these with you.

259.speaker: SASAKO
259.character: この先に　おいしいお店があるって 聞いて　買いに行ったんです
259.definition: I heard that a really good place opened up, so I went to get some. Thank you! I was just getting hungry.

262.speaker: PANDA
262.character: 大丈夫です…　笹は別腹ですから
262.definition: Oh, I'm fine. There's always room for bamboo grass.

263.speaker: POLAR BEAR
263.character: パンダくん　夢のなかでも まだ食べてるみたいだね
263.definition: It looks like Panda's still eating, even in his dreams.

265.character: 助手席で寝るなんて失礼なこと 僕は　しないよ！
265.definition: I-I would never be so rude as to fall asleep in the passenger seat! If you don't speak up, I can't tell if you asleep or awake, Mr. Penguin.

266.speaker: PENGUIN
266.character: 起きてる！　ほんと　信じて！

267.speaker: POLAR BEAR
267.character: いや　寝てても　かまわないけど
267.definition: Well, I wouldn't care if you were asleep. Don't make me sound like Panda!

268.speaker: PENGUIN
268.character: 僕は運転のコツを学ぶんだから
268.definition: I'm going to learn the techniques of driving!

269.speaker: POLAR BEAR
269.character: 免許取ったら　車買うの？
269.definition: Are you going to buy a car once you get your license? I'm not sure.

270.character: この車みたいなミニバンもいいよね～
270.definition: Mini-vans like this are good, too.

271.speaker: PENGUIN
271.character: ああいうのも　かっこいいな～

272.speaker: PENGUIN
272.character: ペン子さん 君に見せたいものがあるんだ
272.definition: There's something I want to show you, Miss Penko.

273.speaker: PENKO
273.definition: Oh, I wonder what it could be? Look, over there. What's that?

282.speaker: POLAR BEAR
282.definition: A saber {\i1}(sa-beru){\i0}. Yodel {\i1}(yo-deru){\i0}. It's a little lonely when there's no one to retort.

291.speaker: PENGUIN
291.character: 何言ってるの？　よくないでしょ
291.definition: What are you talking about? That's not good at all. What are we going to do, Mr. Penguin?

292.speaker: PENGUIN
292.character: そうだなぁ 車屋さん呼べばいいのかなぁ
292.definition: I'm not sure. Maybe we should call a car dealership?

293.speaker: POLAR BEAR
293.character: 慌てない　慌てない

295.speaker: POLAR BEAR
295.character: 引いて帰ればいいから
295.definition: I can just pull it back home.

297.speaker: POLAR BEAR
297.character: コツは　バンパーにツメを引っ掛ける
297.definition: The trick is to wrap your nails around the bumper.

298.speaker: PANDA
298.character: いろいろ 教えてもらえてよかったね
298.definition: It's a good thing he's teaching you all this.

299.speaker: PENGUIN
299.character: 絶対　真似はできないけどね
299.definition: I'm definitely not going to be able to repeat this.

300.speaker: PENGUIN
300.character: まぁ　でも　おもしろいから 写真撮っておこう(＾－＾)V
300.definition: Well, you know... This is amusing, so I'm going to take a picture anyway.

301.speaker: PANDA
301.character: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん　何か面白い話して
301.definition: Mr. Penguin, Mr. Penguin, tell me a funny story.

303.character: 絵に書いたようなむちゃぶりだね
303.definition: That's a textbook way to put me on the spot.

304.speaker: PANDA
304.character: じゃ～今日からペンギンさんのこと　忠実な下部と考えていい
304.definition: Then can I think of you as my loyal servant as of today?

306.speaker: PANDA
306.definition: Mr. Penguin, you're the textbook definition of stingy.

308.speaker: POLAR BEAR
308.character: さ～て　来週のしろくまカフェは
308.definition: Well then, next week on Polar Bear's Café,

310.speaker: PENGUIN
310.character: ちょっと　やめて　そういうの
310.definition: Hey! Would you cut that out?
